intro: Arkezostis simplicifolia, commonly known as the simple-leafed arkezostis, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its simple, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along its slender, woody stem. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers with five petals, which bloom during the short growing season in late spring. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
